text: The Hyloscirtus condor is a frog. It lives in Ecuador. Scientists have seen in exactly one place, 2317 meters above sea level in the Reserva Biológica Cerro Plateado. The adult male frog is 64.83–73.83 long from nose to rear end. The skin of the frog's back is brown with orange spots. The belly is gray. The iris of the eye is gold in color, with lines. The scientists named the frog after the place where they found it: the Cordillera del Cóndor mountains. ==First paper== * ==References== Category:Frogs of South America
title: Hyloscirtus condor
